I miss getName() as well. Here's what I use it for: I often have lots
of lo=
g4j logging messages that spew out of various places (test code
and code-be=
ing-tested) and if a test fails while running from eclipse
(say), the loggi=
ng can be quite revealing about where the bug is
(without having to run the=
 test again with the debugger, etc). With
Junit3, I always overwrote setUp(=
) and did a simple: 

  System.out.println("*** running test: " + this.getN=
ame());

so that I can easily find the logging messages for that test in th=
e
sometimes rather lengthy log.

Lee

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Kent B=
eck" <kentb@...> wrote:
>

convenient

test to

nstitute a good solution depends on what
problem you

 name. Can you say a little more about this?
>  
> Regards,
